page.title: 12WALKDEN SHOPPING PRECINCT
page.content: WALKDEN SHOPPING PRECINCT Walkden shopping precinct was built in 1964 to provide shopping facilities to deal with the growing population following the building of the "overspill" estates.The site was originally occupied by mills and a colliery sales yard.One of the mills was owned by the Labernon Spinning Company.All the original shops were located on Bolton Road. Beneath the precinct there are two canals which used to carry coal from the Plodder Lane coal mine down to Worsley and the Bridgewater canal.The newest shops on the precinct are mainly selling fashion clothes and shoes.People mainly travel from Walkden to shop but some come from Farnworth, Boothstown and Tyldsley, most shopping two or three times a week. By J.M;R.B;J.S;K.B;G.R;N.W.
